meanings.definition: To treat or regard someone as a celebrity or idol.
meanings.sent1: She lionises her favorite singer by attending all his concerts.
meanings.sent2: The fans lionise the movie star by waiting for hours to catch a glimpse.
meanings.sent3: The little girl lionises her pet cat, pretending it's a famous lion.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, he was lionised like a king among men.
meanings.sent5: The town lionised the firefighter who saved the kitten from the tree.

meanings.definition: A person who admires or idolizes someone famous.
meanings.sent1: The young lioniser collected posters of her favorite actor.
meanings.sent2: He became a lioniser of the rock band after attending their concert.
meanings.sent3: The lioniser proudly displayed his autographed photo of the singer.
meanings.sent4: She was a lioniser of the author, eagerly reading all his books.
meanings.sent5: The group of friends teased the lioniser for knowing every detail about the celebrity.
